page.title: 07HOUSES IN & AROUND NENTHEAD
page.content: Most houses are the original 2 storey stone built houses of the miners of the eighteenth and nineteenth century. Many still retain their original stone slab rooves held on by wooden pegs. There are 88 Owner/occupied houses, 23 Council rented and 3 privately rented.Of the Council stock there are 12 <3 bedroomed houses>,3 <2 bedroomed flats> and 8 <1bedroomed flats>. In the area there are 3 holiday cottages and 35 second homes.The majority of second homes are situated in steep and difficult parts on the edge of the village where local folk would not want to live therefore the second homes stop houses falling into further dereliction.
